instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook pro 15 inch touchbar kernel panic
threads.message:
It restarts constantly... sometimes it does manage to boot and the usual first startup screen is visible. In the part where you can connect to a wifi network it tells that it has to do a critical update. after i connect it, it tries to install something but fails with the message: "an error has occured during the istallation".
Probabbly SMC ?
should we try cleaning it with the ultrasonic first ?

threads.title: Macbook pro 15 inch touchbar kernel panic
threads.message:
Any history available?
What board model is?
If has lifeboat connector, remove it and check with USB OSX.

threads.title: Macbook pro 15 inch touchbar kernel panic
threads.message: What is the "lifeboat" connector ? never heard of it

threads.title: Macbook pro 15 inch touchbar kernel panic
threads.message:
If exists, should appear on schematic.
Is recovery connector for SSD, not always available.
